datafield.subfield: Epitome de Tito Livio Bellorum Omnium Annorum DCO
25 x 16 mm, bound to 26 x 17 mm.
Item cataloged from existing description by C. Pierce and J. Fox, and in hand by Erika Milo and Ian Scott, July/August 2018.
Item consists of two summaries of Livy's History of Rome.
The variant title, Epitome de Tito Livio Bellorum Omnium Annorum DCO, is from Loeb.
Collation: Parchment, fol. i (parchment) + 164 + i (ruled but blank) ; 1-9¹⁰ 10⁴ 11-16¹⁰ ; vertical catchwords at foot of the final verso of each quire. Penciled folio numeration in later hand.
Origin: Italy. Coat of Arms has been described as of the De Haye family.
Layout, Epitome Rerum Romanorum: Written in 1 column of 24 lines (dimensions of written space: 16 x 9 mm); vertical rulings, prickings absent, corrections and marginalia in an early hand.

Layout, Ex T. Livy ab urbe condita: Written in 2 columns in 52 lines (dimensions of written space: 280 x 165 mm); ruling in crayon in places; prickings in outer margin; corrections and marginalia in an early modern hand.

Decoration: 3 levels. I. f1r: full page border in green, blue, gold, red, fuchsia, brown and flesh. With illuminated capitals containing profile image of each Author; 5 scene medallions of the Foundation of Rome & 7 portrait medallions with profiles of Roman Kings, 1 additional medallion showing frontal bust of Jesus. II. f19v, 42r, 67r contain 4x3 cm illuminated capital with extensive flourishing decoration and golden orbs. III. Gilt Capital for each chapter upon azure, green and fuchsia square, with white highlights, each with a single vine extending up to 9 cm vertically and accompanied by a single orb with black spindles in the margin.
Decoration: Rubrication throughout; gold illuminations; presence of lapis lazuli.

Binding: Original brown morocco over wooden boards, 6x3 cm arabesque centerpiece and paneled by a 25 mm rectangular border at a margin of 2 cm, as well as an outer border of blind fillets, the backstrip is in 7 panels, crossed by diagonal lines extended into point on each cover. Remnants of four hasps, 2 on front edge, and one on top and bottom. Silk head and tailbands.
Shelfmark: Eugene, OR, Special Collections and University Archives, University of Oregon, MS 001.
Former shelfmark: The Burgess Collection, the University of Oregon Library, 16.
Language: Latin. Cover flyleaf and rear board contain notes written in Italian.

f1r [RUBRIC]"_Annei Flori continentie libroru iiij (super ^or)/ factorum memorabilium ab urbe conditae/ usq ab tempora cesaris augusti secundi im/peratoris. liber primus foeliciter incipit.// nacephaleosis Septem Regum .S. Romuli:/ I lume pompilly Tulli hostilly Anci mar/ tii. Tarquini prisct. Servii tullii & Tar/ quini superbi. Probemium." [TEXT] "POPULUS ROMANUS/ a Rege Romulo in Cesa/rem Augustum Septingen/tos per annos tantum ope/rum pace..."

f19v [RUBRIC] "Lucii annei flori de memorabilibus factis Ro/manorum liber primus finit. Eiusdem x/ liber secundus incipit. Et tertia etas popu/li Romani iuventus. Ante omnia vero ex/italiam comissum est belli^- Siculum." [TEXT] "DOMITA Subastaq italia/ populus Romanus prope Quin/ gentesimum annum agens cu^-/ bone fide adoleuiss& : Si quod robur est si qua vuientus tum vero ille robu/stus ac vvienis & par orbi terrarum esse coepit./...

f42r [RUBRIC line7] "L / ucii Annei Flori liber secundus finit./I / ncipit Liber Tertius/_/Bellum Iugurthinum./ [TEXT] HAEC AD orientem: x/sed non ad occidentem plagam/[...](Cataloger's note: contemporary liber numeration begins book II following chapter XLVII Anacephalaeosis)

f67r [RUBRIC] "L / ucii annei flori liber tertius finit./ E/uisdem quartus & ultimus liber incipit./ Coniuratio Catiline."/[TEXT] CATALINAM luxuria primum. Tum hinc/ conflata egastas rei familiaris/ simul occasio quod in extre/mis mundi finibus arma Romana peregrina."
f89r [RUBRIC] "Sexti ruffi ex .T. Livy ab urbe condita/ primo libra incipit foeliciter." [TEXT] "ADVENTUS/ enee initialiam & res geste/ Africanius. Regnum albe ita/ lie & deinceps Sylviorum /[...]"

Ex T. Livy ab urbe condita.
